title: Message - Comprehensive Examples
description: Multi-line text area (textarea) for forms. Must be child of tpgb/tp-form-block. Supports variable height (lineNum), required validation, help text, autocomplete control, custom sizing.

examples.name: Contact Form Message (Standard 4 Lines)
examples.description: Standard message field for contact forms with 4 visible rows
examples.visualDescription: Textarea with 4 visible lines, required asterisk, full width, placeholder text

attributes.placeholder: Tell us how we can help you...

examples.useCase: Contact forms, inquiry forms, general questions, customer service requests
bestPractices: Use 4-6 lines for standard contact messages (balance between visible space and form length)
Clear placeholder that prompts action ('Tell us how we can help')
Make required (reqTgl: true) for contact forms (message is essential)
Set uniqueid to 'message' or 'inquiry' for easy backend processing
Turn off autocomplete (autoComplete: 'off') for privacy
Keep 100% width for better readability and typing experience

examples.name: Feedback Form with Help Text (6 Lines, Detailed)
examples.description: Larger textarea for detailed feedback with instructional help text
examples.visualDescription: 6-line textarea with help text above field explaining what to include

attributes.placeholder: Please share your thoughts in detail...
attributes.desctxt: We value your feedback! Please tell us what you liked, what could be improved, and any suggestions you have.
attributes.error: We'd love to hear your feedback. Please share your thoughts.

examples.useCase: Product feedback, service reviews, user experience surveys, beta testing feedback
bestPractices: Use 6-8 lines for detailed responses (encourages thorough feedback)
Help text at top (descPoss: 'top') guides user before typing
Explain what kind of feedback you want (liked, improvements, suggestions)
Friendly error message ('We'd love to hear...' vs 'This field is required')
Optional: Add character counter on frontend for longer responses
Consider making optional (reqTgl: false) to reduce barrier to submission

examples.name: Support Ticket Description (8 Lines, Large)
examples.description: Large textarea for detailed bug reports or support requests
examples.visualDescription: 8-line tall textarea for comprehensive issue descriptions, required field

attributes.placeholder: Please provide as much detail as possible: What happened? What were you trying to do? What did you expect to happen?
attributes.desctxt: Include steps to reproduce, error messages, and any relevant screenshots or logs.
attributes.error: Please describe the issue you're experiencing.

examples.useCase: Bug reports, technical support, troubleshooting requests, help desk tickets
bestPractices: Use 8+ lines for technical descriptions (need space for details)
Detailed placeholder with guiding questions (What? Trying to do? Expected?)
Help text below provides additional context (steps, errors, screenshots)
Clear label ('Describe the Issue' vs vague 'Message')
Essential field for support tickets (reqTgl: true)
Consider adding file upload field after this for screenshots
warnings: Long placeholder text may not be fully visible on mobile (keep concise or use help text)
Users may not provide enough detail - backend should prompt for clarification if needed
Don't rely solely on free-form text - consider structured fields for common issues

examples.name: Optional Comments (3 Lines, Compact)
examples.description: Compact optional textarea for additional comments or notes
examples.visualDescription: Small 3-line textarea, optional field, minimal design

attributes.placeholder: Any other information you'd like to share?

examples.useCase: Optional fields in applications, supplementary info, preferences, special requests
bestPractices: Use 2-3 lines for optional/supplementary fields (keeps form compact)
Indicate optional in label to reduce user anxiety
Question-based placeholder ('Any other information you'd like to share?')
Not required (reqTgl: false) - truly optional
Place at end of form (after all required fields)
Useful for capturing unexpected info or edge cases

examples.name: Product Review (5 Lines, Medium)
examples.description: Medium-sized textarea for product reviews or testimonials
examples.visualDescription: 5-line textarea for detailed product feedback, required for review submission

attributes.placeholder: Share your experience with this product. What did you like? How has it helped you?
attributes.desctxt: Your honest review helps other customers make informed decisions. Minimum 50 characters.

examples.useCase: Product reviews, testimonials, customer stories, case studies, service ratings
bestPractices: Use 5-6 lines for reviews (balance between detail and not overwhelming)
Mention minimum character requirement in help text (e.g., 50 chars)
Validate minimum length on backend (prevent 'Good' as entire review)
Guiding questions in placeholder (What did you like? How helped?)
Required for review submission (reqTgl: true)
Pair with star rating field for complete review system

examples.name: Cover Letter/Bio (10 Lines, Extra Large)
examples.description: Very large textarea for long-form content like cover letters or biographies
examples.visualDescription: 10-line tall textarea for extensive writing, full width, required field

attributes.placeholder: Tell us why you're interested in this position and what makes you a great fit...
attributes.desctxt: Write a brief cover letter (200-500 words) highlighting your relevant experience and why you want to join our team.

examples.useCase: Job applications, scholarship essays, bio/about sections, grant proposals, artist statements
bestPractices: Use 10-15 lines for long-form content (gives adequate visual space)
Specify word/character count in help text (200-500 words)
Validate length on backend (too short = incomplete, too long = didn't follow instructions)
Clear expectations in placeholder and help text
Save drafts on client side (localStorage) to prevent loss on accidental refresh
Consider rich text editor for formatted content (bold, lists, etc.)
warnings: Very tall textareas can make forms feel overwhelming (place strategically)
Users may paste from Word (handle special characters, formatting)
Long content = larger form payload (check server limits)
Mobile users may find 10+ lines difficult to edit (consider adjusting lineNum for mobile)

examples.name: Survey Open-Ended Response (6 Lines with Bottom Help Text)
examples.description: Textarea for open-ended survey questions with help text positioned below
examples.visualDescription: 6-line textarea with help text below field, optional to reduce survey abandonment

attributes.placeholder: Your suggestions are valuable to us...
attributes.desctxt: This is optional, but we'd really appreciate your honest feedback on how we can improve.

examples.useCase: Surveys, questionnaires, feedback forms, NPS follow-up, exit surveys
bestPractices: Make optional (reqTgl: false) for surveys to reduce abandonment
Question as label ('What could we do better?' vs 'Comments')
Help text below field (descPoss: 'bottom') as supplementary info
Emphasize value of their input ('really appreciate your honest feedback')
Use friendly, conversational tone in placeholder
Pair with rating/multiple choice questions for structured + open-ended data

examples.name: Message with Custom Width (50% for Multi-Column)
examples.description: Half-width message field for multi-column form layouts
examples.visualDescription: 4-line textarea at 50% width on desktop, 100% on mobile, for side-by-side layouts
examples.useCase: Order forms with notes section, reservation special requests, multi-column application forms
bestPractices: Use custom width (50%) for multi-column layouts (pair with another field)
Responsive: 50% desktop (md), 100% mobile (sm) for readability
Always unit: '%' for responsive layouts
Shorter lineNum (3-4) works better in constrained width
Use for supplementary info (special requests, dietary restrictions, etc.)
Test readability at 50% width - may need adjustment for long words
layoutTips: Place two 50% width fields side-by-side (e.g., Special Requests + Delivery Instructions)
On mobile, fields stack vertically automatically
Don't use for primary message field (use full width instead)

commonPatterns.description: 4-line required message field for contact forms
6-8 line textarea with guidance for detailed responses
Compact 2-3 line optional field for supplementary info
Large textarea for cover letters, essays, bios

validationRules.labelss: Required - Field label displayed to user
validationRules.reqTgl: Optional - Boolean, true = required, false = optional
validationRules.placeholder: Optional - Placeholder text, can be empty string
validationRules.lineNum: Optional - String representing number of visible rows (e.g., '2', '4', '10'), default '2'
validationRules.error: Optional - Custom error message for required validation
validationRules.hlpTxt: Optional - Boolean, true = show help text, false = hide
validationRules.desctxt: Conditional - Required if hlpTxt is true, help text content
validationRules.descPoss: Optional - 'top' or 'bottom', position of help text, default 'top'
validationRules.inpSz: Optional - Responsive width {md, sm, xs, unit}, default 100%
validationRules.uniqueid: Optional - Unique field identifier for backend processing

warnings: Textarea allows unlimited text (users can paste novels) - validate max length on backend
lineNum controls visible height, not maximum characters (users can type/paste beyond visible area)
No client-side character limit - implement on backend (e.g., 5000 chars max)
Placeholder text may not wrap on all browsers (keep concise or use help text)
Very tall textareas (lineNum > 10) can make forms feel overwhelming
Users may paste formatted text from Word/Google Docs (strip formatting on backend)
Mobile keyboards can cover textarea on small screens (test thoroughly)
autocomplete='off' may not be respected by all browsers (especially password managers)
Textareas don't resize automatically - fixed height based on lineNum
Empty textareas still take vertical space (lineNum rows) - consider visual design impact
commonMistakes: Using single-line text field instead of textarea for messages (use textarea for multi-line)
Setting lineNum too small (1-2 lines) for required messages (use 4+ for important content)
Setting lineNum too large (15+ lines) for optional fields (overwhelming users)
Not validating maximum length on backend (users can submit megabytes of text)
Generic labels ('Message', 'Comments') instead of specific ('Your Feedback', 'Describe the Issue')
No guidance in placeholder or help text (users don't know what to write)
Making every textarea required (reduces form completion rate)
Using pixel width (inpSz: {md: '500', unit: 'px'}) - breaks responsive design
Not making mobile full-width (sm: 100) when using custom desktop width
Forgetting uniqueid for backend processing (field data gets lost)
bestPractices: Use 4-6 lines for standard messages (good balance)
Use 6-8 lines for detailed responses (feedback, bug reports)
Use 2-3 lines for optional/supplementary fields (compact)
Use 10+ lines for long-form content (cover letters, essays) sparingly
Provide clear labels: 'Describe the Issue' not 'Message'
Use help text to guide users (what to include, word count, examples)
Set uniqueid for easy backend processing (use snake_case)
Validate max length on backend (prevent abuse, database limits)
Turn off autocomplete (autoComplete: 'off') for privacy-sensitive content
Make required (reqTgl: true) for essential fields only
Use percentage width (unit: '%') for responsive design
Always set sm: 100 for mobile when using custom desktop width
Use friendly, specific error messages ('Please describe the issue' vs 'Required')
Consider minimum character count for quality responses (50+ chars)
Test on mobile - virtual keyboard takes screen space
accessibilityNotes: Textarea must have clear label (labelss attribute)
Screen readers announce label and input type (textarea)
Placeholder text is accessible hint (not label replacement)
Error messages announced by screen readers when validation fails
Keyboard navigation: Tab to field, Type/Arrow keys to edit, Shift+Tab to exit
Help text (desctxt) is associated with textarea for screen readers
Required fields should have visual indicator (asterisk) and aria-required
Error state should have aria-invalid when validation fails
Provide clear character count if enforcing limits (accessible to screen readers)
lineNum affects visual height but doesn't limit accessibility
performanceConsiderations: Textarea is native HTML element (no external library = fast)
No performance impact on page load
Large textareas (10+ lines) take more visual space but same performance
Validation happens on form submit (minimal performance cost)
Very long user input (>10KB) can slow form submission slightly
Backend should limit max length to prevent DoS (e.g., 5000-10000 chars)

characterLimitRecommendations.Note: Enforce max length on backend, display counter on frontend for user guidance

lineNumGuidelines.15+ lines: Rarely needed - consider rich text editor instead

tips: Clear placeholder: 'How can we help you?'
Pair with name, email, subject fields
Help text explaining what feedback you want
Consider making optional to reduce barrier
Follow up with users who provide detailed feedback
Help text: include steps, errors, screenshots
Pair with file upload for screenshots/logs
Validate minimum length (prevent 'broken' as entire ticket)
Guiding questions: What liked? How helped?
Pair with star rating for complete review
Display character count to encourage detail
Consider rich text editor for formatting
Allow file upload as alternative (attach cover letter PDF)
